tweet: Earlier this year I introduced the bipartisan #RURALAct to bring high-speed, reliable broadband internet to the rural areas of our country.  https://bit.ly/36kwjkA

I also discussed the importance of expanding broadband into rural areas so that #smallbiz have the opportunity to compete on the same level as businesses in more urban areas. https://youtu.be/7L056VVAS4Q

Today at the Senate Homeland Security & Govt Affairs Committee hearing I highlighted the importance of ensuring that the US is a leader in 5G technology & engaged in broadband standard setting so that we are on a level playing field w/ countries like China https://youtu.be/nbC2a9buSdo

There's no place for hazing in our society & that’s why I'm proud to support the bipartisan END ALL Hazing Act. Students & parents in #Ohio & around the US deserve the transparency & accountability this bill will provide to ensure the safety & security of those headed to college.

I’m also pleased that this bill includes my amendment to ensure that foster youth remain eligible for the Tenant Protection Fund. W/out this bipartisan amendment, the Tenant Protection Voucher would have ended, upending the lives of countless foster youth in Ohio & across the US.

It also includes funding for my bipartisan NPS Centennial Challenge program to ensure our national parks receive the resources they need in order to preserve our nation’s treasures for generations to come.

The Senate-passed funding measure increases funding for #GLRI by $9M bringing the total to $310M. GLRI is a successful public-private partnership that works to protect the water quality and ecosystem of our Great Lakes

The Senate passed the FY 2020 CJS, Ag, Interior, THUD funding bill which includes several of my key priorities that will work to protect our #GreatLakes, national parks, & #Ohio’s foster youth.  https://bit.ly/2pwtImZ

The deadline to apply for the Spring 2020 Senate Page Program is November 15th. If you are from #Ohio and interested in this unique opportunity to learn firsthand about our nation’s legislative process, you can apply on my website:  https://bit.ly/36kQ6Av

We also can’t ignore other deadly drugs like meth & cocaine. My Combating Meth & Cocaine Act gives state & local governments greater flexibility with federal grant money to address the resurgence of these drugs affecting our communities.  https://bit.ly/2XilcHp

We can’t take our eye off the ball when it comes to addressing this crisis. I’ve recently introduced the bipartisan #FIGHTFentanyl Act to permanently criminalize fentanyl-related substances. The current controlled substance order will expire Feb 6, 2020  https://bit.ly/2Ws5pCR

Earlier today on the @SenateFloor, I highlighted the progress my legislation like #STOPAct, #CARA & State Opioid Response grants have made in combating the #opioidcrisis but there’s more to do. https://youtu.be/MMuUANXVLIA

The Global Engagement Center is tasked w/ leading US govt efforts to counter propaganda & disinformation from countries like #Russia thanks to the bipartisan legislation I wrote and successfully passed in 2016.

Earlier today at a Senate Foreign Relations Committee hearing, I secured a commitment from the nominee for U.S. Ambassador to Russia, John Sullivan to, if confirmed, fully utilize the Global Engagement Center & continue to provide assistance to #Ukraine. https://youtu.be/ZS2bxjZfIRI

These grants will help those on the frontlines in #Ohio combat the #opioidcrisis as we work together to turn the tide of addiction. I’m pleased that the admin. has taken a leading role in combating this crisis & I will continue working with them to turn the tide of this epidemic

I authored the Drug-Free Communities Act more than 20 years ago & it remains the most effective program for consistently reducing youth drug use. I welcomed the Trump admin’s announcement today of both new and continued grant recipients in #Ohio.  https://bit.ly/36ceRP8

I was proud to meet this American hero & I’m grateful for his continued service to our nation. Last night, Sgt. 1st Class Waters received the Angels of the Battlefield Award in recognition of his life-saving medical treatment & trauma care on the battlefield.

Honored to have Sgt 1st Class Greg Waters & his wife Jill at our weekly #BuckeyeCoffee. Greg, a Canton, #Ohio native, was awarded the Distinguished Service Cross for his heroic actions in Afghanistan when he ignored his own injuries & saved the lives of 3 of his fellow soldiers. pic.twitter.com/qGtWQ1bdPn

Today the Senate stood w/ #Dayton & condemned the horrific attack that claimed the lives of 9 innocent people earlier this year. I’m proud of the way Dayton has come together in support of one another & I’m grateful to my Senate colleagues for passing this resolution unanimously.

I’ve recently introduced the Combating Meth & Cocaine Act to help states respond to a surge of overdoses caused by these drugs in our communities. My bill will ensure state opioid response grant funds can also be used for programs focused on treating meth & cocaine addiction

We’re starting to see fewer overdose deaths due to opioids thanks in part to legislation I’ve helped to enact like #STOPAct, #CRIBAct, #CARA & #CURES, but it’s just a start.  We must continue to address the broader issue of addiction.

Interesting read in @AXIOS today about the Council of Economic Advisors report on the $696 billion cost of the #opioidcrisis in 2018 to the US. We must continue to do everything we can do curb this continuing addiction crisis. https://www.axios.com/were-all-paying-for-the-opioid-epidemic-2d6a1262-3cf7-49c3-b63a-9c4ca827ec9b.html?utm_source=American+Action+Forum+Emails&utm_campaign=722c538919-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2019_01_07_08_31_COPY_01&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_64783a8335-722c538919-267124769 …

There’s momentum in #Ohio today w/ businesses expanding & seeking skilled workers but we must help by closing the skills gap. My bipartisan #JOBSAct will help more students gain the academic & technical skills, knowledge &training necessary to succeed in the #jobs available today
https://youtu.be/6qPrj26vCE0

Earlier today on the @SenateFloor, I highlighted the need to continue to build on the economic progress we’ve made by improving skills training & addressing the shortage of skilled workers to fill today’s in demand #jobs. Passing my bipartisan #JOBSAct will help.

As I highlight in a recent “Dollar & Sense” podcast w/ @BrookingsInst’s @davidrdollar, Canada & Mexico are #Ohio’s 2 largest trading partners & that’s why Congress must pass #USMCA to strengthen our economy & support #Ohio’s farmers & manufacturers. #jobs https://www.brookings.edu/podcast-episode/sen-rob-portman-on-the-importance-of-a-fair-global-trading-system/ …

I’m grateful for their support on this important legislation and I hope we can pass it here in Congress soon in order to give Americans the opportunity to fill these in-demand #jobs and reach their God-given potential. https://www.crainscleveland.com/editorials/crains-editorial-better-futures …

From @CrainsCleveland about my bipartisan #JOBSAct: “Can this year’s version of the JOBS Act finally make it into law? We hope so. This kind of expansion of training is one of the few issues that has support across the country among Republicans and Democrats.”
https://www.crainscleveland.com/editorials/crains-editorial-better-futures …

Good read from @CrainsCleveland highlighting my visits around #Ohio to discuss the need to address the skills gap. My bipartisan #JOBSAct will make high-quality & rigorous short-term #job training programs more affordable by expanding access to Pell Grants for low-income students
Sad to hear of the passing of my former colleague, Senator Kay Hagan of North Carolina. Jane and I will keep her family & loved ones in our prayers & hope they find comfort in this time of grief.

I also reiterated what I’ve said many times before, that we must create a level playing field with #China to help American workers, farmers & manufacturers while also holding them accountable for unfairly taking our intellectual property & violating international trade laws.

On the @BrookingsInst Dollar & Sense podcast, I highlighted the many reasons why that #USMCA is superior to the status quo, including creating 176,000 new #jobs, establishing new enforceable labor standards & providing a section on digital trade  https://www.brookings.edu/podcast-episode/sen-rob-portman-on-the-importance-of-a-fair-global-trading-system/ …

Thanks to @davidrdollar for including me in his @BrookingsInst podcast, Dollar & Sense. We discussed the importance of passing #USMCA & the need to create a level playing field with #China. #jobs #Ohio  https://www.brookings.edu/podcast-episode/sen-rob-portman-on-the-importance-of-a-fair-global-trading-system/ …

Overdose deaths across #Ohio due to fentanyl-related substances have deeply impacted our communities. I introduced the bipartisan #FIGHTFentanyl Act last week to permanently schedule illicitly manufactured and deadly fentanyl.  https://bit.ly/340lUbK
It serves as an important reminder of the horrible atrocities inflicted upon the people of Warsaw & the perseverance of a people whose spirit cannot be broken.  https://bit.ly/31JY56H
I introduced a bipartisan resolution last week marking 75 years since the Polish Home Army, the young & brave Polish Resistance, took up mostly homemade arms against insurmountable odds.

In an op-ed for @clevelanddotcom I said I hope we see the day when security grants are not necessary b/c we will abide by the admonition to love our neighbor as ourselves. In the meantime, let’s do all we can to give our religious communities the assistance they need to be safe.

In September I hosted an #Ohio faith-based security conference at the Jewish Community Center in #Columbus w/ federal & state security experts & local faith-based & nonprofit groups to highlight best practices for how to prepare, prevent, respond & recover from threats. pic.twitter.com/KFEPDbmcJV

This year I introduced the Protecting Faith-Based & Nonprofit Organizations From Terrorism Act to ensure that synagogues, churches, mosques & other religious & cultural institutions have the training, info &resources they need to secure their facilities against increasing threats

An attack on any house of worship is an attack on us all. As we commemorate one year since the horrific attack on the Tree of Life Synagogue in Pittsburgh, I join the Jewish community & all faith communities in standing against hate of any kind.
While terrorist organizations like ISIS will continue to require our attention for years to come, this is welcome news in our tireless efforts for a safer, more secure world.

Good news that ISIS founder & leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi has been brought to justice. Members of our military & the intelligence community deserve our gratitude for their bravery & professionalism on this successful mission & for the sacrifices they make every day for all of us.
https://bit.ly/2Pm7rTw

My bipartisan Deepfake Report Act passed the Senate on Thursday & is the first deepfake related bill to pass a chamber of Congress. It will require the federal govt to conduct an annual report so we can better understand deepfakes & the threat they pose to our national security.

As co-founder & co-chair of the Senate Artificial Intelligence (AI) Caucus, I’ve worked in a bipartisan manner on legislation to set high-quality standards around emerging tech, including cybersecurity & AI.
https://youtu.be/9SaUNoJp3HY

I chaired a hearing on Thursday to speak w/ experts & hear how Congress can help build on the report’s findings to produce legislative solutions to some of these problems & improve these systems to ensure American’s voices are heard during the rule making process.

They’re examples of the abuse of the federal government’s online regulatory comment systems. As chair of the Permanent Subcmte on Investigations I unveiled a bipartisan report that highlights these abuses & the govt’s lack of sufficient response to them  https://bit.ly/2pKcC4V

What do these things all have in common?

•Comments posted by dead people like Elvis Presley & Richard Nixon

•Comments containing the entire text of War and Peace;

•Comments containing threats of violence against govt officials & comments w/ excessive profanity.

The #STOPACT is a crucial law in helping to stop the influx of synthetic opioids into our communities. Some progress has been made, but I will continue to work to ensure that the #USPS fully complies with the #STOPAct so we can keep fentanyl out of the US.  https://bit.ly/2TVa9OD

Do you have old prescription medication taking up space in your cabinet? Tomorrow is National Prescription Drug #TakeBackDay. Keep your loved ones safe and find a location closest to you to return your unused or expired RX drugs here:  http://takebackday.dea.gov

The new Boston Mill Visitor Center is an example of successful public-private partnership, with funding from the National Park Service’s Centennial Challenge Fund for the parking lot leveraging significant additional funding for the visitor center. pic.twitter.com/y4GwMjepsE

As AI rapidly becomes an intrinsic part of our economy & society, AI-based threats like deepfakes have become an increasing threat to our democracy that we must address. I applaud my Senate colleagues for passing this bipartisan legislation & hope the House will take it up soon.

Last night the Senate passed my bipartisan Deepfake Report Act which directs the Department of Homeland Security to address the challenge of deepfakes by conducting an annual study on the threat they & similar content present.  https://bit.ly/363HYUN
https://bit.ly/2W9wgTY

In 2017 alone we had a record 3,523 overdose deaths attributable to fentanyl-related substances in #Ohio. This bipartisan legislation is vital to our efforts to keep fentanyl out of our communities & I urge my colleagues to join me in passing the #FIGHTFentanyl Act.

Fentanyl has hit #Ohio communities particularly hard. This deadly, synthetic drug knows no zip code & is devastating individuals & families across the US. Today @Sen_JoeManchin &  I introduced the bipartisan #FIGHTFentanyl Act to permanently schedule fentanyl-related substances.

We must make it clear that overproducing steel, as #China has done, is unacceptable. Overcapacity hurts #Ohio & American steel workers and it’s important we create a level playing field for trade.  https://bit.ly/2BLIrwN

Ahead of the Global Steel Forum, @SenSherrodBrown, @SenatorBraun, @SenBobCasey & I sent a letter to @USTradeRep urging the admin to prioritize steel overcapacity. For too long, foreign countries like #China have not been held accountable for overcapacity of steel products.

Today @SenSherrodBrown and I introduced a bipartisan resolution honoring the 75th Anniversary of the Warsaw Uprising & the thousands of Poles who bravely stood up & fought against the German Nazi occupation of #Warsaw.  https://bit.ly/31JY56H

This morning, I am chairing a bipartisan Permanent Subcmte on Investigations hearing with federal agencies about how best to improve online comment process, & ensure Americans have a voice in rulemaking process. Watch live here: https://www.hsgac.senate.gov/subcommittees/investigations/hearings/review-of-e-rulemaking-comment-systems …

I’m hopeful that this bipartisan report will start a discussion between Congress & the federal agencies about how we can make online comment systems work better both for government agencies and the American people.  https://bit.ly/2p0xXXZ

However, the online comment systems are too often being abused, & agencies have not taken adequate steps to address that misuse. Victims of identity theft are being misrepresented on federal govt websites & agencies are doing little to protect them.

The online comment process provides Americans with the opportunity to voice their opinions & provide meaningful input to federal agencies, while ensuring that these agencies have the best info possible when proposing new rules and regulations.

Today, as Chair of the Permanent Subcmte on Investigations, I released a new bipartisan report w/ Ranking Member @SenatorCarper that documents abuses of the federal govt’s online regulatory comment systems & lack of sufficient response to those abuses.  https://bit.ly/2JkUNjI

#USMCA includes new & enforceable environmental and labor standards, a section on digital trade, expanded opportunities for ag trade, & new opportunities for auto #jobs in America. #USMCA is an agreement for America’s future and it’s time for the House to bring it to a vote.

Earlier today on the @SenateFloor, I urged the US House of Representatives to pass #USMCA. Our farmers, manufacturers, & American workers will benefit from this trade agreement.  We need to put the American people first, politics second, and get this done. https://youtu.be/BnwQ1K4CQ7w

We must continue to do everything we can at the federal lvl to ensure #Ohio & the rest of our nation have the resources they need to help our communities heal. I’ll continue to lead efforts in the Senate to combat addiction & help individuals live up to their God-given potential.

Today is the one year anniversary of @POTUS signing the SUPPORT Act into law, a landmark opioid reform package that includes my bipartisan #STOPAct, Improving Care Act, #CRIBAct & key initiatives from #CARA2. Already, these laws are helping combat the #opioidcrisis. pic.twitter.com/SfjG15xTA9

Great conversation with #Ohioans this morning at my weekly #BuckeyeCoffee. We were able to discuss critical issues facing our state, including looking for a solution to #Ohio’s high infant & maternal mortality rates. pic.twitter.com/OAXT9UA9fF

Glad to see the two Island Class #CoastGuard cutters I helped secure delivered to #Ukraine.  It is important to help our ally protect their coastline against future threats.

Across #Ohio I’ve heard from our farmers & manufacturers and they all agree, Congress should pass #USMCA as soon as possible. #USMCA will create 175k+ more American #jobs and boost our economy. This trade agreement makes sense, it’s time to stop stalling, Let’s pass #USMCA.

I’ll continue my work at the federal level to ensure #Ohio communities, like those in Scioto County, have the support they need in order to heal these communities that have been scarred by the #opioidepidemic.

This @BostonGlobe story is the perfect example of the positive impact local communities can have on turning the tide on the #opioidepidemic. I’m proud of the great work Dale King is doing for the people of #Portsmouth. http://apps.bostonglobe.com/nation/politics/2019/10/voters-2020-election/ohio/portsmouth/ …

I’ve lead efforts at the federal level through my bipartisan State Opioid Response grants to ensure that communities like #Portsmouth receive the resources they need but it’s important that organizations at the local level, like Dale King's gym, are involved in finding solutions.

King opened the Portsmouth Spartan Kettlebell Club in an effort to give those struggling with opioid addiction a community they could turn to and work on their recovery & wellness. In turn, some of King’s students have gone on to work in the gym or in the community.

Good read from @BostonGlobe about the devastating impact the #opioidcrisis has had on #Ohio communities like Portsmouth and the incredible work people like Dale King are doing to help individuals suffering from addiction.  http://apps.bostonglobe.com/nation/politics/2019/10/voters-2020-election/ohio/portsmouth/ …

I‘m grateful for the courageous & fast response from our law enforcement & first responders & I’m proud of the way Dayton has come together as a community in support of one another. We must never forget those who were lost in this tragic attack.

Proud to introduce a resolution today with @SenSherrodBrown condemning the senseless & evil attack that took place in Dayton earlier this year. We must stand together in condemning these cowardly acts.  https://bit.ly/2MTIpIo

We can’t take our eyes off the broader issue of addiction. As I said in my column for @ClermontSun, I will continue to lead efforts in the #Senate to help our communities have the tools and resources they need to combat addiction https://www.clermontsun.com/2019/10/19/sen-rob-portman-theres-more-work-to-do-on-opioid-addiction/ …

While we’ve begun to see progress in combating opioid addiction, other drugs are making a resurgence. Cocaine & meth are on the rise which is why I’ve introduced legislation to open up State Opioid Response grants to the current addiction crisis.

These sorts of breakthrough programs are making a difference, but there is still a long way to go. That’s why I was pleased that @HHSgov recently announced that #Ohio would receive more than $55M in additional State Opioid Response Grant funding to help sustain these efforts.

This summer, I had the opportunity to ride-along w/ Columbus Fire Department’s RREACT team & see firsthand how they're working to combat the opioid addiction crisis. RREACT is using an $800,000 #CARA grant on an intervention program w/ skilled rapid response teams.

Thanks to our local law enforcement there’s less heroin & fewer RX pills on our streets. What’s more, first responders are receiving funding through my bipartisan #CARA & #CURES law that is being used in innovative new approaches to ensure individuals receive treatment & recovery

Jane & I appreciate Pastor Peter Mingo, First Lady Regina & the entire congregation for their generous hospitality every time we visit. Pastor Mingo has been a friend since he joined the Coalition for a Drug Free Greater Cincinnati that I founded in the 90s. pic.twitter.com/1fwzevMuSB

I was proud to celebrate the 35th anniversary of Christ Temple Full Gospel Baptist Church with my dear friend Pastor Mingo and present him with a US flag flown over the Capitol. I’m grateful for all Pastor Mingo does for Cincinnati’s community. pic.twitter.com/MAapyNTnQh
https://bit.ly/2Vt0GQK

We’re starting to turn the tide on opioid addiction in our country, but the underlying issue of addiction still needs to be addressed. I will continue to work with local leaders and state officials to ensure our communities have the resources they need to combat this crisis.

Bipartisan legislation I have worked on like #CARA & the 21st Century #CURES Act have provided state & local govt & nonprofit groups in #Ohio w/ support for proven prevention, recovery, and treatment programs to help addicted individuals heal.

NAFTA is 25 years old & we all agree it should be modernized. Congress should pass #USMCA this year because it will help our workers, farmers & manufacturers. We’ve waited long enough -- it’s time for the House to act. #jobs

I applaud the @StateDept decision to require Chinese diplomats to notify State before any meeting with US colleges or universities or w/ any local or state officials. I’m pleased that @GoodwillIntl of NW #Ohio received a nearly $1M grant through my bipartisan Second Chance Act in order to help fund their important “Stay the Course” program that targets medium to high risk incarcerated individuals who need help preparing to rejoin the community

Last week, I met Amanda at @GoodwillIntl of NW #Ohio and heard about how she was able to fulfill her God-given potential through the opportunities afforded to her through Goodwill’s “Stay the Course” program, which utilizes funding through Second Chance Act.

My bipartisan Second Chance Act has changed thousands of lives in #Ohio by helping break the cycle of incarceration through drug treatment and #job training programs. I enjoy meeting #Ohioans who have been able to change their lives around as a result of Second Chance programs.

I want to thank @ENERGY Secretary Rick Perry for working with me on our energy & national security priorities in #Ohio, including at #Piketon, which is an important asset in our country’s nuclear defense system.

Next year, in order to board a domestic flight with your driver’s license, you’ll be required to have a REAL ID. Beat the rush to the @Ohio_BMV by getting yours sooner rather than later. Find your closest location here:  https://ohiobmv.gov/87.aspx

While we’re beginning to see a reduction in opioid overdoses, we must continue to address the addiction crisis in our country. More in my column for @gd_trib: https://www.mydailytribune.com/opinion/columns/45564/progress-treating-addiction-more-to-do …

One of my top priorities this fall is passing legislation that will ensure we can tackle drug addiction in all its forms. My Combating Meth and Cocaine Act will ensure state opioid response grant funds can also be used for programs focused on treating meth & cocaine addiction.

Earlier this week I toured Talan Products in #Cleveland as a part of my #JOBSAct and Workforce Tour. We had a really informative discussion on the importance of ensuring #Ohio workers get the skills training they need for the #jobs available today. https://youtu.be/3wtlNbO_fSc

On the @Senatefloor, I recently highlighted my bipartisan Retirement Security & Savings Act which includes 57 provisions to help Americans have a safe & secure retirement. https://youtu.be/Tv1RjwSDUZU
As we come to the end of National Save for Retirement Week, let’s redouble our efforts to be sure that all Americans have the tools they need to successfully prepare for their retirement years.

As I said at the #Ohio 2019 Recovery Conference earlier this week, I will continue to work w/ local communities and organizations across #Ohio to help ensure they have the support and flexibility they need to respond to the new threats, including crystal meth. pic.twitter.com/nILv97AwuZ

Our communities continues to be in a crisis as #Ohioans of every age suffer from drug addiction. My bipartisan #CARA, #STOPACT and #CURES legislation have helped to finally turn the tide on the opioid addiction but there’s more to do.

For too long, we modeled the appropriate behavior in the hopes that #China will follow our lead and they haven’t. China will not change unless it sees its actions have consequences and this recent decision by the admin is a positive first step.

Important read from @WashingtonPost's @joshrogin about the @StateDept’s announcement yesterday that Chinese diplomats inside the US are now required to notify the US govt before visiting state or local officials as well as academic or research institutions https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/global-opinions/washington-gives-chinese-diplomats-a-taste-of-their-own-medicine/2019/10/17/d74f0b7a-f11c-11e9-8693-f487e46784aa_story.html …

Earlier this year, as chair of the Permanent Subcmte on Investigation, I released a bipartisan report that demonstrated the lack of transparency & reciprocity between #China & the US – specifically in respect to Confucius Institutes.   https://bit.ly/2We5hFQ
#China’s persistent interference with U.S. public diplomacy efforts contradicts the important diplomatic principle of reciprocity that is recognized in international tradition & law.

Good news that an agreement was reached for the US to remain in the Universal Postal Union, leveling the playing field for American shippers. Now we need to strengthen electronic data requirements on all mail shipments at the 2020 @UPU_UN talks #STOPAct #UPU

For too long the U.S. has modeled appropriate behavior in the hope that #China will change.  As we have learned, China will not change unless it sees its actions have consequences & this news is a positive first step.  https://bit.ly/2qnqna3

As chair of the Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations, I released a bipartisan report earlier this year that detailed instance after instance of the Chinese government interfering w/ U.S. visits, programs, and events throughout China.  https://bit.ly/2We5hFQ

I’m pleased that the @Statedept is now working to level the playing field w/ China on US public diplomacy efforts by requiring Chinese diplomats to notify the State Dept before any meetings w/ US colleges and universities, or any local or state officials.   https://bit.ly/2qnqna3

It’s time to for Congress to pass #USMCA so we can create more #jobs and a stronger economy. #NAFTA is 25 years old & our trade relationship w/ Canada & Mexico must now be updated to reflect the economic realities of today.

There are hundreds of #jobs in #Ohio that employers are having a hard time filling due to the #opioidcrisis & skills shortage. Now more than ever the private sector has a powerful incentive to work w/ us to help combat the #opioidcrisis.

Overdose statistics and high rates of addiction among those out of work aren’t just numbers — they represent people with broken dreams. We all have a role to play in getting people off the sidelines and back to productive lives so they can live up to their God-given potential.

In an op-ed for @WashingtonPost, I discussed the #opioidepidemic & how it is impacting our economy. It is vital for the private sector to work with the public sector & take on an active role in combating the #opioidcrisis  https://bit.ly/2KZSbHk

Important read from @AP about how the #opioidcrisis has cost our economy $631B over the last 4 years. The new study from @SOActuaries finds the biggest driver of the cost is the lifetime earnings that go unrealized when an individual dies from an overdose. https://www.apnews.com/8a4c97e621af4026a22d6462b425702c?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axiosam&stream=top …

In my column for @recordherald, I highlight that while legislation like my bipartisan #CARA & #CURES have helped combat the drug crisis in #Ohio & in our nation, there is still more to do to turn the tide of addiction. https://www.recordherald.com/opinion/45361/weve-made-progress-but-still-more-to-do …

Recently, in Portsmouth, #Ohio $35,000 worth of meth was seized in an apartment. Authorities in Whitehall found nearly 30 lbs of cocaine in a drug bust in Sept. & nearly two dozen individuals were arrested recently for trafficking meth & heroin in #Ohio & WV.

Funding is set to expire in December for Money Follows the Person & I will continue to fight to renew MFP and ensure that all Americans can continue to have a choice in where they seek long-term care support.

I’m proud to receive the @TheRealANCOR Congressional Champion Award for my support for the Money Follows the Person (MFP) program & my bipartisan EMPOWER Care Act. #MFP has provided 10,000+ #Ohioans the opportunity to receive the care they need in their homes & communities. pic.twitter.com/010RPWxDO7

These #Ohio teachers were selected based on their distinction in the classroom & dedication to improving STEM education. I’m grateful for their tireless dedication to #Ohio’s students. They have made our state proud.
Congratulations to Nancy Edmondson, Gloria Gajewicz, Lisa Holt-Taylor & Julie Randolph on receiving the Presidential Excellence Award in Science, Mathematics, & Engineering for the state of #Ohio!

Proud my bipartisan Congressional Budget Justification Transparency Act has received support from 23 different organizations. Taxpayers deserve to know where their tax dollars are being spent & this legislation will ensure there is one central online location w/ that information.

There are about 2000 job openings today in #CuyahogaCo for manufacturing. The #jobs are there, we just need skilled workers to fill them. My bipartisan #JOBSAct will help to extend Pell Grants to students to make these training programs more affordable https://youtu.be/3wtlNbO_fSc

My bipartisan #JOBSAct will help make skills training more affordable for those reentering the workforce. The mistakes of our past should not define our future.

Last week, I joined a bipartisan group of my Senate colleagues in sending a letter to @usedgov urging an immediate discharge of outstanding federal student loans for permanently disabled Americans.  https://bit.ly/2OKGOqS

The last thing families dealing w/ the sudden permanent disability of a child need is a heavy financial burden from student loans. I introduced Domenic’s Law earlier this year to help parents whose child develops a total & permanent disability qualify for student loan discharge.

Happy 244th birthday to the US Navy! The men & women who serve in our Navy and America’s Navy veterans deserve our thanks. I’m grateful for their sacrifice in order to keep our nation safe. #HappyBirthdayNavy

For far too long, prescription pain medication, heroin, and fentanyl have broken families apart and devastated communities in Ohio. We’re starting to see a turn in combating opioid addiction but cocaine & meth are quickly becoming a larger issue.

My bipartisan legislation, Domenic’s Law, which I introduced earlier this year, will allow parents whose child develops a total and permanent disability to qualify for student loan discharge. Greiving parents shouldn’t have to worry about paying off student loans.

Today is #WorldMentalHealthDay. We must address mental health just as we address physical health. Take care of yourself & your loved ones. We all need to look out for one another.

We’re beginning to turn the tide on the addiction epidemic. However, we must stay focused, keep doing what’s worked thus far and respond aggressively to the new threats from meth and cocaine.  https://bit.ly/2Vt0GQK
The USPS must enforce the law enacted by #STOPAct to ensure fentanyl doesn’t enter our country via our own postal system from #China in the first place.
Yesterday Toledo law enforcement made the largest bust of fentanyl in Toledo history. They were able to stop 21lbs of fentanyl from entering our communities.

Our communities are looking for help as there are still far too many people losing their lives to the scourge of addiction. My bipartisan #STOPAct has helped to reduce the flow of synthetic drugs like fentanyl into the US but drug traffickers are still finding ways to bring it in

Unfortunately, we’re continuously hearing that other drugs like meth & cocaine are becoming more common. I introduced legislation that will make allow State Opioid Grant funds to also be used for programs focused on treating meth and cocaine addiction.

#Ohio led the country in the decline of overdose deaths last year & I was pleased that the administration announced that our state would receive more than $55M in additional State Opioid Response Grant funding to help sustain these efforts.

We’ve made progress in treating addition since 2017, & we’ve started to turn the tide against opioids. This is good news for #Ohio & for our nation & is due in part to legislation I’ve helped to enact like #CARA & #CURES, but there’s still work to be done  https://bit.ly/2Vt0GQK
